problems.title: Smallest Sufficient Team (Bit Manipulation)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

In a project, you have a list of required skills req_skills, and a list of people. The ith person people[i] contains a list of skills that the person has.
Consider a sufficient team: a set of people such that for every required skill in req_skills, there is at least one person in the team who has that skill. We can represent these teams by the index of each person.
For example, team = [0, 1, 3] represents the people with skills people[0], people[1], and people[3].
Return any sufficient team of the smallest possible size, represented by the index of each person. You may return the answer in any order.
It is guaranteed an answer exists.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
java nodejs reactjs
java
nodejs
nodejs reactjs

Sample Output
0 2

Explanation: Team [0,2] has all required skills.

Sample Input
algorithms math java reactjs csharp aws
algorithms math java
algorithms math reactjs
java csharp aws
reactjs csharp
csharp math
aws java

Sample Output
1 2

Explanation: Team [1,2] has all required skills.
problems.constraints:
1 <= req_skills.length <= 16
1 <= req_skills[i].length <= 16
req_skills[i] consists of lowercase English letters.
All the strings of req_skills are unique.
1 <= people.length <= 60
0 <= people[i].length <= 16
1 <= people[i][j].length <= 16
people[i][j] consists of lowercase English letters.
All the strings of people[i] are unique.
Every skill in people[i] is a skill in req_skills.
It is guaranteed a sufficient team exists.

        # TODO: Return any sufficient team of smallest size (list of indices)
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    lines = [line.strip() for line in sys.stdin if line.strip()]
    req_skills = lines[0].split()
    people = []
    for i in range(1, len(lines)):
        people.append(lines[i].split())
    sol = Solution()
    result = sol.smallestSufficientTeam(req_skills, people)
    print(' '.join(map(str, result)))

hintsList: Use dynamic programming with bitmask to track which skills are covered.
For each person, represent their skills as a bitmask and use DP to find minimum team size.
